author: Mahesh Langa
text:
BJP president Amit Shah is set to be inducted as a trustee in the Somnath temple trust.

The trust is headed by the former Chief Minister of Gujarat, Keshubhai Patel. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and BJP leader L.K. Advani are members in it.

The temple trust meeting was held at the Prime Minister’s residence in Delhi where a resolution was passed to induct Amit Shah as a trustee and extend the term of Keshubhai Patel as Managing trustee for 2016.

“Amitbhai is a devotee of Somnath Mahadev and is a regular visitor of the temple so it has been decided that he be inducted into the body,” said secretary of the trust P.K. Laheri, a former Chief Secretary of Gujarat.

The trust members have also decided to promote tourism activities on Somnath and Diu coast in Saurashtra and develop infrastructure.

Located on the Saurashtra coast, the historic Somnath is the first among the 12 Adi Jyotirlings of Hindusim and was restored from ruins after Independence. The first President Dr. Rajendra Prasad had inaugurated the present-day temple in May 1951. The restoration works for the temple was started at the instance of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel and was supervised by noted writer and Congressman Kanaiyalal Munshi.
title: Amit Shah to join Somnath Trust
